meanings.sent1: My progenitors came from a long line of hardworking farmers.
meanings.sent2: The researcher traced her family tree back to her progenitors in Europe.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, we all joked about how our progenitors must have been expert gardeners.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins stood as silent reminders of the progenitors of civilization.
meanings.sent5: In the old photo album, faded pictures of our progenitors told stories of the past.

meanings.sent1: The inventor was hailed as the progenitor of the groundbreaking technology.
meanings.sent2: As the progenitors of the movement, they paved the way for future generations.
meanings.sent3: The artist proudly displayed the painting as the progenitor of her artistic style.
meanings.sent4: The small bookstore was the progenitor of a thriving literary community.
meanings.sent5: The first notes of the melody served as the progenitors of a beautiful symphony.

meanings.sent1: The wise elder was respected as the progenitor of the village.
meanings.sent2: The forefathers of the nation laid the foundation for its democratic principles.
meanings.sent3: In the legend, the mythical creature was believed to be the forefather of all dragons.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins were said to be the forefathers of the modern city.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tree was considered the forefather of the forest, standing tall and proud.
